.@realDonaldTrump, I am watching your White House monologue...please stop talking!  The federal government is partially shutdown and 800,000 federal employees are not being paid.  Please stop the bragging, the bluster, the nonsense and get to work opening the government! Enough!

The #TrumpShutdown is wreaking havoc on our National Parks. Without visitor services or park rangers to protect our public lands, conditions are seriously deteriorating. Democrats will act swiftly to pass bills to bring this needless shutdown to an end. https://t.co/CklrOSM3Jk
My heartfelt condolences to the family and loved ones of Lance Cpl. Riley S. Kuznia. https://t.co/6bC9uwLviJ

The #TrumpShutdown has cut off funding for gov't services for nearly 1.9 million Native Americans – putting their health and safety at risk. Congress must act quickly to ensure that our Native brothers and sisters have access to the resources they need: https://t.co/Z0IK5c8nW9

Congratulations to Congressman Jim Langevin on being the first Speaker pro tempore on day one of the 116th Congress! Jim and I began serving in Congress the same year, and I am thrilled to see him presiding on the first day of the new Democratic majority.

Tomorrow, the new Democratic House will take rapid action to reopen all government services, ensure federal workers receive their hard-earned paychecks, and restore certainty to the American people. @HouseDemocrats are ready to hit the ground running and work #ForThePeople

Proud to vote for my colleague @NancyPelosi as Speaker of the House. Nancy’s tenacity and commitment to serving the people will move our country forward. Under her leadership, @HouseDemocrats are ready to end the #TrumpShutdown and get to work.

Miss the December 15th deadline to enroll in @MNsure? No problem! MNsure open enrollment is still in full swing. The final deadline to enroll in a plan for 2019 is JANUARY 13th. Visit https://t.co/Rvk2QGH5qv to compare plans and #GetCovered today.

Thousands of federal employees are going w/o pay during the #TrumpShutdown, and the president is doling out pay raises to his senior political appointees. This is outrageous. I stand w/ @RepMikeQuigley in calling on the White House to rescind this action. https://t.co/Gc8XK68iHA

.@HouseDemocrats are working hard to bring the #TrumpShutdown to an end and get our country moving again. I’m proud to co-sponsor the #ForThePeople Act – a set of reforms to strengthen our democracy and return political power to the people. https://t.co/akmypi3FWA

Today is day 17 of the #TrumpShutdown. Federal employees like TSA agents & air traffic controllers are working without pay to keep our nation safe. @realDonaldTrump needs to take responsibility for the impact of his shutdown and end it immediately.

Thank you to @GovMarkDayton for your years of dedicated public service as the Governor of Minnesota. Governor Dayton truly left Minnesota better off for our children and grandchildren. Thank you, Mark!

Congratulations to @GovTimWalz and @LtGovFlanagan on your inauguration as Minnesota’s next governor and lieutenant governor! I’m looking forward to working with your administration as you build #OneMinnesota.
I know from our many years of working together in the U.S. House that @keithellison will serve Minnesota well as its next Attorney General. Congratulations, Keith!
Minnesota is in good hands with @julieblaha as State Auditor. Congratulations on your inauguration!
Looking forward to continued progress for Minnesota voters under Steve Simon’s leadership as he’s sworn in for a second term as MN’s Secretary of State. Congratulations, @MNSteveSimon!

Climate research has stopped and a probe into deadly gas explosions is on hold. Yet oil drilling applications and meetings to open up ANWR continue to move forward. Today’s headlines paint a clear picture of this administration’s mixed-up priorities during the #TrumpShutdown. https://t.co/r2lcjlLbnk
Legislation to expand background checks is essential to keeping our children & families safe from gun violence. I strongly support @RepThompson and H.R. 8.

I am saddened by the passing of my friend and former MN House colleague Tom Rukavina. While we didn’t always agree, it was an honor to fight alongside him on behalf of hardworking Minnesotans. His passion for the people he represented and sense of humor will be missed.

Somehow, the historic US gov’t site at the Trump International Hotel is still open and staffed by National Park Service rangers. Yet the #TrumpShutdown is leaving our national parks unsupervised and cluttered with trash. This hypocrisy is unacceptable.

Trump speech highlights the crisis of leadership America faces. Trump shutdown for 18 days. No end in sight. No wall funds from Mexico or GOP when they controlled Congress.  GOP should join Dems to end Trump chaos & pass veto proof funding bills. That's putting America first!

Today I joined my Democratic colleagues in voting to reopen the @USDA, @US_FDA, @USDOT, and @HUDGov. @HouseDemocrats did their job – now it’s time for @SenateGOP to do theirs and reopen the government so we can see fewer notices like this one. https://t.co/0HBp8KA1Ix

Tomorrow, 800,000 federal workers will miss a paycheck because of the Republican shutdown. The GOP controlled Congress & the White House for two years and did nothing to prioritize their wall. This crisis is a direct result of @realDonaldTrump's failed leadership. #EndtheShutdown

Republicans have so few arguments to defend their shutdown that they’ve resorted to complaining about not spending enough money. @HouseDemocrats’ priority is to get our government reopened and our federal employees paid – now.

stopping inspections of drinking water systems, hazardous waste mgmt facilities, & chemical facilities.

This morning, I’m bringing to the House floor the Interior-Environment funding bill to reopen the @Interior, @EPA, and other related agencies as part of @HouseDemocrats' efforts to end the #TrumpShutdown and make sure federal workers get paid.

Today, I called out the Trump admin for violating appropriations law to irresponsibly keep understaffed national parks open during the shutdown. @NPCA & @DemocracyFwd agree: until we reopen the gov't, close our parks to protect resources and public safety. https://t.co/MNlOcskYAs

Democrats support smart, effective border security solutions like new technology to scan vehicles and improvements to personnel staffing/infrastructure at our ports of entry. But we will not waste billions of taxpayer dollars on an ineffective wall.

Once again, we have failed to meet our treaty responsibilities
to tribal nations.

Basic services like health clinics, tribal justice services, and food assistance for seniors are being put at risk for nearly 1.9 million people throughout Indian Country. #EndTheShutdown

The #TrumpShutdown is placing our national parks – America’s crown jewels – under threat. Lasting damage is being done to our parks and their long-term upkeep is being compromised.

It is time to reopen the government.

I applaud the federal court in NY’s decision to remove the citizenship question from the #2020Census. We must stop the Trump administration from obstructing census participation. Thanks to the community and faith-based orgs for working together to ensure every person is counted.

The #TrumpShutdown is doing lasting harm to Indian Country and our public lands. As incoming Chair of the Interior-Environment Appropriations Subcommittee, I’ll join @RepRaulGrijalva this morning to hear testimony from tribal leaders and other experts on the impacts.

I was proud to vote today for the #FAIRAct, which eliminates the false choice Americans are currently subjected to, & restores the private arbitration system to its original intent – providing a *voluntary* alternative process for resolving disputes & restoring access to justice.

None of the safeguards of our judicial system apply to the arbitration process. No real judge, no jury, & no right to appeal. It’s a closed process, allowing businesses to avoid accountability for disputes involving sexual harassment, discrimination, & unsafe work conditions.

84% of voters from both sides of the aisle oppose forced arbitration. Americans understand just how unfair it is – yet many consumers don’t know that it’s often a pre-condition for cell phone contracts, credit card applications, and even employment.

Congress has officially taken its last votes of the year (and of the decade!), so I want to share some highlights from the past year since Democrats took control of the House of Representatives:
Thank you, @RepDeanPhillips! Your support is critical to protecting #BWCA for future generations. Proud to stand together in this fight.

The House also approved additional legislation to safeguard our elections, the #SHIELDAct & SAFEAct. We also passed #HR4 to expand protections for voters under the #VotingRightsAct, after a Supreme Court decision removed many of these protections in 2013.
In the face of a culture of corruption embraced by Pres. Trump & the GOP, the House passed #HR1—the #ForThePeople Act—to restore and strengthen our democracy & elections.

The House passed #HR3, which expands the services Medicare covers & addresses the skyrocketing cost of prescriptions – like insulin, which has seen a 197% cost increase. We're working to #LowerDrugCosts & reduce out-of-pocket medical expenses #ForThePeople.

The crisis of climate change has been top of mind. We passed #HR9, which would prevent Mr. Trump from pulling the U.S. out of the Paris Climate Agreement. I joined @SpeakerPelosi at #COP25 to send a message to the rest of the world: #WeAreStillIn. https://t.co/XUyDaBEbp0
.@HouseDemocrats fought hard to ensure all 12 appropriations bills make investments that reflect our Democratic priorities: to #ProtectOurCare, #ActOnClimate, #EndGunViolence, and more.
$36 billion in federal funding will be signed into law to protect clean air & water, fund Indian health care & education programs, fight climate change, protect our public lands, and more.

House Democrats are also committed to making sure the economy works for everyone – not just those at the top. We passed legislation to raise the minimum wage & ensure equal pay for equal work, and ensure retirement security for seniors through the #ButchLewisAct.

Our oversight actions led to the @USGAO finding that the Trump admin broke the law by using national park entrance fees to keep parks open during the #TrumpShutdown. Congress holds the power of the purse—period. We’ll keep holding this admin accountable.

The House also passed #HR8 to help address gun violence from another angle – strengthening background checks for gun purchases to keep guns out of the hands of those who shouldn’t have them. We’re committed to keep fighting to end this epidemic.

I led the first-ever Defense Appropriations hearing devoted to the intersection of climate change & national security. This bill prioritizes the #ClimateCrisis with historic investments in clean energy & resilience to protect facilities, readiness, and global security. (5/8)
This bill prohibits funds from being used to operate the Guantanamo Bay detention facility after September 30, 2022, supporting @POTUS’ call to end this stain on our national conscience. (7/8)

This bill also invests in the health, safety, & wellbeing of our service members by reaffirming our commitment to preventing sexual assault in the military, and providing $36.7 billion for health care & medical research programs – including $522 million for cancer research. (4/8)

Our Defense @AppropsDems bill values the brave people serving our nation – providing a 2.7% pay raise to all 2.1 million uniformed U.S. service members and approximately 750,000 civilian DoD employees. (3/8)

Our Defense @AppropsDems bill is an American jobs bill, funding millions of jobs in clean energy, cyber, and advanced manufacturing, and supporting a high-tech, high-skilled workforce of the future. (2/8)

In sum, our Defense @AppropsDems funding bill is about people & their quality of life, American jobs, and the U.S.'s leadership role in promoting our democratic values around the world. I’m proud of these investments in keeping America safe, secure, and successful. (8/8)

#2⃣: It is a place of respite and recreation – the beauty of its 1.1 million acres of lands and waters is unmatched. #SaveTheseWaters

#3⃣: Studies show keeping the BWCA pristine boosts the long-term success of the region’s recreation-based economy and saves thousands of jobs. This is why so many businesses, hunter/angler groups, local outfitters, and more support #HR2794 to #SaveTheseWaters.

On a day meant to celebrate love, I can’t help but feel heartbroken.💔

Heartbroken for each and every family who has lost a loved one to gun violence. 

Heartbroken for the trauma inflicted on young people just trying to live their lives and build their futures. (1/4)

We cannot let our grief become complacency. 

We cannot let our thoughts and prayers become an excuse for inaction. 

I ask you to join me in demanding that Members of Congress on both sides of the aisle do the right thing and find the courage necessary to act. (4/4)

To reflect this, I’m changing the approach I use to respond to these preventable tragedies. I will keep acknowledging these acts of violence when they happen, and extend my condolences to victims and their families – but know that each one is a call to action. (3/4)

And heartbroken for each one of us as Americans, as we share in grief and helplessness while these acts of violence persist in our nation.

Mass shootings have become all too frequent, but we cannot accept them as commonplace. (2/4)

If we want a modern military that reflects the American public, we cannot treat half of it like second class citizens.
